acknowledgments.summary: Honeywell reported these vulnerabilities to CISA.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities allows an attacker to perform remote code execution.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA recommends users take the following defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-20-056-05 - Web Scraped Version

notes.text: The affected product is vulnerable to a cross-site request forgery, which may allow an attacker to remotely execute arbitrary code.CVE-2020-7005 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.1 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Honeywell recommends users with potentially affected products take the following steps to protect themselves:

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of HTTP Headers for Scripting Syntax

notes.text: The header injection vulnerability has been identified, which may allow remote code execution.CVE-2020-6982 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.3 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Honeywell recommends users with potentially affected products take the following steps to protect themselves:

notes.text: The affected product is vulnerable due to the usage of old jQuery libraries. CVE-2020-6978 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.2 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary
